sentence: Arizona Attorney General Mark Brnovich told the justices that even tacit approval of what the Biden administration did would set a precedent future presidents would abuse, using the courts to get rid of previous administration policies without going through the usual regulatory process.
author: Stephen Dinan
title: Supreme Court struggles for a solution to Biden’s handling of immigration ‘Public Charge’ rules

sentence: Justice Elena Kagan suggested to Arizona Attorney General Mark Brnovich, arguing for the group of states, that allowing the group to intervene in a case “that’s completely dead that never applied to you in the first place” is not the answer.
author: Via AP news wire
title: High court wades into clash between Biden, Republican states

sentence: "Whoever the federal government is, there's always going to be a state that thinks it's done the wrong thing," Kagan told Arizona Attorney General Mark Brnovich.
author: John Fritze
title: Supreme Court weighs whether Arizona can join lawsuit over Trump-era immigration rule

sentence: That left states that favored the public charge rule without recourse, Arizona Attorney General Mark Brnovich (R) told the justices Wednesday.
title: Supreme Court considers whether Biden administration properly ditched Trump immigration rule

sentence: Justice Elena Kagan suggested to Arizona Attorney General Mark Brnovich, arguing for the group of states, that allowing the group to intervene in a case “that’s completely dead that never applied to you in the first place” is not the answer.
author: Jessica Gresko
title: High court wades into clash over Trump-era immigration rule

sentence: The justices heard oral arguments in an appeal by 13 Republican state attorneys general led by Arizona Attorney General Mark Brnovich of a lower court's ruling that rejected their bid to defend Trump's rule, which expanded the scope of those considered likely to become a "public charge."
author: Andrew Chung
title: U.S. Supreme Court Mulls Republican Bid To Defend Trump Immigration Rule
Supreme Court Weighs Whether States May Defend a Trump Immigration Policy

sentence: Justice Elena Kagan suggested to Arizona Attorney General Mark Brnovich, arguing for the group of states, that allowing the group to intervene in a case “that’s completely dead that never applied to you in the first place” is not the answer.
author: JESSICA GRESKO
title: High court wades into clash over Trump-era immigration rule

sentence: Arizona Attorney General Mark Brnovich argued that Biden’s strategy is “an unprecedented legal maneuver.” Because Biden dismissed the remaining legal challenges to the public charge rule, Arizona argues that states that supported the rule were left with no recourse.
author: Jordan Dixon-Hamilton
title: Supreme Court Hears Arguments Over ‘Public Charge’ Rule
